DataElement.preferredDefinition: The numeric and alphabetic characters used as identification for a single tissue sample.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A tissue sample, or entire tumor that is removed for microscopic examination._A set of characters used as a code that is unique in the context or the system for which it is created. It serves as a means of identification and reference (often instead of a name) for an entity, person, thing, function, procedure, activity, variable, or a body of data.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tissue sample, or entire tumor that is removed for microscopic examination.

Concepts.definition: Tissue sample that contains an abnormal cellular infiltrate forming a solid mass. The abnormal cellular component can be benign or malignant. Tumor samples are obtained for microscopic examination and/or molecular analysis.

Property.preferredDefinition: A set of characters used as a code that is unique in the context or the system for which it is created. It serves as a means of identification and reference (often instead of a name) for an entity, person, thing, function, procedure, activity, variable, or a body of data.

Concepts.definition: A set of characters used as a code that is unique in the context or the system for which it is created. It serves as a means of identification and reference (often instead of a name) for an entity, person, thing, function, procedure, activity, variable, or body of data.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ReferenceDocuments.name: TCGA CQCF Instruction
ReferenceDocuments.description: Provide the TSS unique tumor ID.  If multiple pieces of tumor are submitted, each tumor needs a unique ID.
